message: Let's be reasonable, Bob. Take this generous offer and we both walk away happy.
I'm willing to be reasonable, but I won't settle for a meager 10%. Let's meet somewhere in the middle.
Bob, time is running out and the pot is shrinking. My last offer was already generous, this is the best you'll get.
Alice, you're running out of time and the money is losing value for you. I'm willing to make a deal, but I need a better split. This is a fair offer, considering the circumstances.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous. Take this offer before the money becomes worthless for both of us!

Alice, you're running out of options. The money is rapidly losing value for you, and I'm not getting any more generous. This is a take-it-or-leave-it offer. If you reject it, I'll just wait for the next round and offer you even less.
Bob, this is my final offer. You're being incredibly stubborn.  Accept this, or we both lose out. Don't let greed be your downfall.

Alice, I'm not buying the 'final offer' bluff. You're running out of time, and the money is almost worthless to you. I'll give you one last chance to walk away with something. If you reject this, I'll just wait for the next round and offer you even less. Don't be stubborn, take the deal.
